Class InputHandler

java.lang.Object
org.example.InputHandler
public class InputHandler extends Object
The InputHandler class provides utility methods to handle various types of user input validation. It includes methods for getting valid string and integer inputs, user choices, sorting fields, and checking if the user wants to continue the program.

  • Method Details

    • getUserChoice

      public static int getUserChoice(Scanner scanner)
      Prompts the user to choose an option for NPC creation, ensuring valid input is provided. Valid options are: 1 - Enter NPC parameters manually 2 - Use default NPC set
      Parameters:
      scanner - The Scanner object to read user input
      Returns:
      The choice of the user (1 or 2)

    • getValidString

      public static String getValidString(String prompt, Scanner scanner)
      Prompts the user to enter a valid string input that consists of only letters and spaces.
      Parameters:
      prompt - The message to prompt the user for input
      scanner - The Scanner object to read user input
      Returns:
      A valid string input that matches the pattern (letters and spaces only)

    • getValidInteger

      public static int getValidInteger(String prompt, int min, int max, Scanner scanner)
      Prompts the user to enter a valid integer within a specified range.
      Parameters:
      prompt - The message to prompt the user for input
      min - The minimum allowed integer value
      max - The maximum allowed integer value
      scanner - The Scanner object to read user input
      Returns:
      A valid integer input within the specified range

    • getSortingFields

      public static String[] getSortingFields(Scanner scanner)
      Allows the user to select two fields for sorting NPCs. The available fields are: - Name - Level - Health Points - Agility - Role - Faction
      Parameters:
      scanner - The Scanner object to read user input
      Returns:
      An array of two chosen fields for sorting

    • askToContinue

      public static boolean askToContinue(Scanner scanner)
      Prompts the user to indicate whether they want to continue the program or not. Valid responses are "yes", "y", "no", or "n".
      Parameters:
      scanner - The Scanner object to read user input
      Returns:
      true if the user wants to continue, false if they want to exit
